note.p: Career: Bishop of Oxford; Bishop of Winchester (1869-1873); died after being thrown from his horse, Abinger, Surrey Downs

The Dean of Ely gave notice that at the next meeting of the Society, <he would propose> [crossed out] the Bishop of Oxford <would be proposed> [inserted as superscript] for Election as Fellow of the Society, and for immediate Ballot; to which as a Peer of the Realm he is by the Statutes entitled.

In accordance with the notice given at the last Meeting, the Very Rev.d the Dean of Westminster proposed the Lord Bishop of Oxford for immediate Ballot, to which he was entitled. The Ballot being taken, his Lordship was declared duly elected.
